occasions.title: Columbus Discovers the New World
occasions.description: Christopher Columbus' first voyage across the Atlantic Ocean led to the discovery of the New World, marking the beginning of European exploration and colonization of the Americas.

trivia.question: What year did Columbus set sail from Spain?
Which island did Columbus first land on?
How many ships did Columbus have on his first voyage?
What was Columbus searching for when he set sail?

occasions.reflection: Studying this event made me realize how interconnected the world became after Columbus' discovery. It was eye-opening to learn both the positive and negative impacts of European exploration.
occasions.challenges_faced: Understanding the biases in historical accounts was difficult. Many sources glorified Columbus without acknowledging the harm caused to indigenous populations.
skills_gained: Understanding the impact of European colonization

key_events.event: Columbus sets sail from Spain on August 3rd.
Columbus reaches the Bahamas on October 12th.

occasions.title: Spanish Invasion of the Americas
occasions.description: The Spanish invasion of the Americas, led by Hernán Cortés, resulted in the fall of the Aztec Empire and the establishment of Spanish colonial rule over vast territories in the New World.

trivia.question: Who led the Spanish invasion of the Americas?
Which empire fell due to the Spanish invasion?
What was the name of the Aztec emperor during the invasion?
What disease helped the Spanish conquer the Aztec Empire?

occasions.reflection: This event taught me about the brutality of conquest and how it's shaped the modern world. It also made me more aware of how history is written by the victors.
occasions.challenges_faced: It was hard to grasp the scale of the suffering caused by the Spanish invasion. Also, balancing different historical perspectives was challenging.

key_events.event: Cortés arrives in Mexico and begins his march toward Tenochtitlan.
The Aztec Empire falls after the siege of Tenochtitlan.

occasions.title: Founding of Jamestown
occasions.description: The founding of Jamestown in 1607 marked the establishment of the first permanent English settlement in North America, laying the foundation for English colonization and expansion in the New World.

trivia.question: Which company funded the Jamestown settlement?
Who was the leader of the Jamestown colony?
What cash crop helped Jamestown become profitable?

occasions.reflection: Learning about Jamestown helped me understand the roots of modern America. It also emphasized how fragile early settlements were and the resilience of settlers.
occasions.challenges_faced: I struggled to understand the economic motivations behind colonization and how it created lasting inequalities.
skills_gained: Understanding economic and social factors in colonization

key_events.event: English settlers establish Jamestown on May 14th.
The first African slaves arrive in Jamestown.

occasions.title: The Triangular Trade
occasions.description: The Triangular Trade was a system of transatlantic trade between Europe, Africa, and the Americas, involving the exchange of goods, slaves, and raw materials. It played a significant role in shaping economic and social systems in all three regions.

trivia.question: Which three regions were involved in the Triangular Trade?
What was commonly traded from Africa to the Americas during the Triangular Trade?
What goods were sent from the Americas to Europe in the Triangular Trade?
Which European country played a major role in the Triangular Trade?

occasions.reflection: Studying the Triangular Trade deepened my understanding of how interconnected global economies were, even in the early modern period. It also highlighted the devastating human cost of the transatlantic slave trade.
occasions.challenges_faced: It was challenging to fully comprehend the scale of human suffering involved in the slave trade and how it shaped modern societies.
skills_gained: Awareness of the human impact of historical events
Critical thinking in analyzing historical sources

key_events.event: The Triangular Trade begins with the exchange of goods between Europe and Africa.
First African slaves arrive in Jamestown, marking the expansion of the slave trade to English colonies.
Britain abolishes the slave trade, marking the beginning of the end for the Triangular Trade.
